SEARCH

Class BASIC

java.lang.Object
BASIC
public class BASIC extends Object
The main class for managing users, properties, and bookings in a basic property management system. This class provides a simple text-based menu interface for user interaction.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Mert Can Bilgin

    • comparePropertyPricesPerDay

      public static void comparePropertyPricesPerDay(int propertyId1, int propertyId2)
      Compare the properties' prices per day
      Parameters:
      propertyId1 - First property ID to be compared
      propertyId2 - Second property ID to be compared

    • addInspectionToProperty

      public static void addInspectionToProperty(int propertyId, String inspectionText)
      Add an inspection to the property.
      Parameters:
      propertyId - The property ID.
      inspectionText - The inspection text.

    • getUserBooking

      public static void getUserBooking(int userId)
      Displays the booking details for a user with the specified user ID. If the user has no bookings, it prints a message indicating that there are no bookings.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user for whom booking details are to be displayed.

    • getBookingCost

      public static void getBookingCost(int userId, int propertyId)
      Calculates the total booking cost for a user and a property based on their respective IDs. If the user or property does not exist, it prints a message indicating their non-existence.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user for whom the booking cost is to be calculated.
      propertyId - The ID of the property for which the booking cost is to be calculated.

    • getDiscountPercentageForUser

      public static double getDiscountPercentageForUser(int userId)
      Get the discount percentage.
      Parameters:
      userId - The user id.
      Returns:
      The discount percentage

    • addBooking

      public static void addBooking(int userId, int propertyId)
      Adds a booking for a user and a property based on their respective IDs. Before adding the booking, it checks if the specified user and property exist. If they exist, it prompts the user for booking details with the specified start and end dates.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user for whom the booking is being added.
      propertyId - The ID of the property for which the booking is being added.

    • getPropertyById

      public static Property getPropertyById(int propertyId)
      Return the property with the specified ID. Don't recommended to be used without checking if the property exist.
      Parameters:
      propertyId - The ID of the property to be returned.
      Returns:
      A Property object.

    • deleteProperty

      public static void deleteProperty(int propertyID)
      Delete the property from the list.
      Parameters:
      propertyID - The property ID to be deleted.

    • deleteUser

      public static void deleteUser(int userID)
      Delete the user from the list.
      Parameters:
      userID - The user ID to be deleted.

    • addProperty

      public static void addProperty()
      Add a property to the list.

      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • isUserAvailable

      public static boolean isUserAvailable(int userID)
      Check if the host is in the users list.
      Parameters:
      userID - The user ID to be checked.
      Returns:
      True if the user exists, otherwise false.

    • addUser

      public static void addUser()
      Add a user to the users list.

    • exit

      public static void exit()

    • parseDate

      public static Date parseDate(String userDate)
      Parses a date string in the format "dd/mm/yyyy" entered by the user and returns a Date object. If the input does not match the expected format, the user is prompted to enter a valid date format.
      Parameters:
      userDate - The date string to be parsed in "dd/mm/yyyy" format.
      Returns:
      A Date object representing the parsed date.

    • isUserAndPropertyExist

      public static boolean isUserAndPropertyExist(int userId, int propertyId)
      Checks whether a user with the specified user ID and a property with the specified property ID exist.
      Parameters:
      userId - The user ID to check for existence.
      propertyId - The property ID to check for existence.
      Returns:
      `true` if both the user and the property exist; otherwise, `false`.
